sources.title: Nine Hours To Rama (1963) Diane Baker · Horst Buchholz
sources.description: The last hours before the violent death of Mahatma Gandhi (1948).   The focus is neither on the great Indian nor on a coherent analysis of the religious-political background to his assassination, but rather on the loosely formulated life story of the young murderer, presented according to the successful American formula. Little more than colorful adventure cinema with sparse psychological depth.

metadata.Plot: "Nine Hours to Rama" depicts the life of Nathuram Godse the assassin of Mahatma Gandhi. How Godse planned the assassination is shown in the film. How he became a Hindu activist who (unfairly) blamed Gandhi for the killings of thousands of Hindus by Muslims is revealed in a series of flashbacks.
metadata.Actors: Horst Buchholz, José Ferrer, Valerie Gearon
metadata.Awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Award1 nomination total
